quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Bass
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, bass, marley. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: He was the bass player for The Beatles.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul

questions.question: He played bass for The Who.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Entwhistle

questions.question: The Osmond Brothers started out at a stint in Disneyland until this famous person invited them to his talk show several times thus launching their career?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andy Williams

questions.question: At the end of Sesame Streets theme song there is a harmonica solo, played what famous jazz harmonica player?

options.text: Max Geldray from the Goon Show

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jean Toots Thielemans

questions.question: The song Running Bear, sung by Johnnie Preston, was written by one of the three famous musicians to whom Don McLean paid tribute with American Pie”. Who was he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jiles Perry Richardson, Jr

questions.question: Singer Andy Williams did a comedy sketch in which he would get madder and madder at a puppet and scream Not now, not ever. Never. His outburst was comical because Andy was known to be quite easy-going. What was the name of the puppet from this sketch?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cookie Bear

questions.question: He played bass on many of James Browns early hits before joining George Clintons band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bootsy Collins

questions.question: He played bass on several of Elvis early hits.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Black

questions.question: On February 3, 1959, musician Waylon Jennings would have died with Buddy Holly, had he not given up his seat in their plane to this popular pioneer of rock and roll and a friend of his.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ritchie Valens

questions.question: He played bass for Bob Marley.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ashton Barrett

questions.question: Donna Fargo was best known for what signature song from 1972?

options.text: The Happiest Girl In the Whole USA

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Happiest Girl In the Whole USA

questions.question: February 3, 1959 became known as the day the music died after Don McLeans song American Pie was released. The song was in memory of a plane crash killing three popular musicians and carried the name of the ill-fated plane.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: American singer Don McLean was discovered by a woman who thought he was so great when she heard him sing, that she wrote a song about the experience. Who was she?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lori Lieberman

questions.question: American singer Don McLean wrote many different songs that were in tribute to one person or another. Which song of his was in tribute to Fred Astaire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wonderful Baby

questions.question: Did Iron Maiden release the song Two Minutes to Midnight in 1984?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Bassist and Bass
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, zeppelin, jackson. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these is the bassist for The Red Hot Chili Peppers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Peter Balzary

questions.question: Who played bass for Black Sabbath?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Geezer Butler

questions.question: Bill Haley was the lead singer for The Comets. Who was their bassist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marshall Lytle

questions.question: Which of these bassists did not play with King Crimson?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Jammerson

questions.question: He was the bassist for The Grateful Dead.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phil Lesh

questions.question: What was the first Motown song to land in the top 3 of the charts?

options.text: Money (Thats What I Want) - Barrett Strong
You Beat Me to the Punch - Mary Wells

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Money (Thats What I Want) - Barrett Strong

questions.question: He was the bassist for Cream.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Bruce

questions.question: Anthony Jackson is a great sessions bassist who he has played with many of the famous musicians  and groups. What else is he known for?

options.text: Winning more Grammy Awards than any other bassist
Winning the Down Beat Magazine Award for the best bass player nine years in a row
Inventing a one pound electric bass

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Inventing the six-string bass guitar

questions.question: For whatever reason there are few female bassists. Which of these is not the name of one of them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joanna Lee

questions.question: One of the first groups Berry Gordy signed to Motown was called The Matadors. They later changed their name to which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Miracles

questions.question: Who played bass for Phish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mike Gordon

questions.question: His slap bass technique is heard on many of the hits of  Sly and the Family Stone.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Larry Graham

questions.question: Berry Gordy founded Motown Records on January 12th of what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1959

questions.question: He was the bassist for Led Zeppelin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Paul Jones

questions.question: Timothy Schmit was the bassist for this group.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Eagles

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Motown and Group
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, birds, alto. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This tenor player hit a rough spot in his career in the 1950’s. He went out onto the Brooklyn Bridge every night for a year playing his sax. Somehow he got out of his funk and revived his career. He was famous for wearing a Mohawk hairdo for several years.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sonny Rollins

questions.question: Who replaced  Florence Ballard in The Supremes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cindy Birdsong

questions.question: Besides being a great alto player, he also played flute and bass clarinet. His best album was Out to Lunch. He died in Berlin because of a wrong diagnosis.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eric Dolphy

questions.question: Sometimes known as The Queen of Motown, Mary Wells had several big hits until her departure from the label in 1965. Which of these was her first?

options.text: The One Who Really Loves You
You Beat Me to the Punch

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The One Who Really Loves You

questions.question: Who replaced David Ruffin in the Temptations?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dennis Edwards

questions.question: Marvin Gaye was a great solo artist, but also had many wonderful duets with the various ladies of Motown. Who was his partner on the classic, It Takes Two?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kim Weston

questions.question: This group, (that formed in 1957), had some minor hits before signing with Motown, but their biggest success came after they left the label.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Isley Brothers

questions.question: Motown had many great female groups in the 1960s. This group, originally known as The Del-Phis and then The Vels had a top 10 hit with this tune that went to #8 on the pop charts in the fall of 1963.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martha Reeves and The Vandellas

questions.question: This great tenor player, born in 1904, was famous for his sweet yet soulful sound, most notably on his rendition of Body and  Soul.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coleman Hawkins

questions.question: What LP did Stevie Wonder release in 1972 that told the world he was on his way?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Music of My Mind

questions.question: Smokey Robinsons wife stopped touring with The Miracles in 1964 due to health reasons and left the band permanently.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The Four Tops were one of Motowns premiere groups for a long time, going for over 40 years without a single change in their line-up.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Smokey Robinson was their lead singer, but who were the Miracles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ron, Pete , Bobby and Claudette

questions.question: This tenor player called Prez was considered the best tenor player in the world. Because of racial discrimination he refused to play in the southern USA.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lester Young

questions.question: The Mynah Birds were a minor group that was signed to Motown in 1966. Its members included Neil Young and Bruce Palmer (both future members of Buffalo Springfield). What other member of this group had quite a bit of success as a solo artist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rick James

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Years
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, nickname, timmy. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Nicknamed Jeru, this great baritone sax player was raised in New England. His duets with Chet Baker have become classics. One of the most interesting part of his quartets was the non-use of pianos. What was this musicians last name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mulligan

questions.question: This great saxophonist played on the hit song by Bill Withers Just the Two of Us.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grover Washington, Jr.

questions.question: Timmy Gatling, a former founding member of the group Guy, went on to have semi-success with this song.

options.text: So You Like What You See

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Help

questions.question: This male quartet asked the question Him or Me. Who are they?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Today

questions.question: Born in Philadelphia and raised in The Bronx, New York, this tenor had a great career with Woody Hermann’s band and later helped bring in the bossa nova sound to the USA.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stan Getz

questions.question: Foster and McElroy had great success as producers/writers/performers, most notably with the recording of the song Dr. Soul. They were also successful with the production of this all girl group of Funky Divas.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: En Vogue

questions.question: A Muppet character was based on this great saxophonist who played for many years with Woody Hermann.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zoot Sims

questions.question: This handsome singer portrayed a drug dealer named Kareem Akbar in the movie New Jack City and had a hit song called Promises, Promises.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christopher Williams

questions.question: What was the nickname of Charlie Parker, one of the top bebop musicians?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yardbird

questions.question: This new jack swing group had a 1992 hit with the song Live and Learn.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Public

questions.question: What female artist released Tapestry, Rolling Stone magazines #36 album on the top 500 list?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carole KIng

questions.question: This great alto player is most famous for playing on Billy Joels Just the Way You Are” and on Steely Dans Dr. Wu.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phil Woods

questions.question: This great alto player was an important part of The Dave Brubeck Quartet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Desmond

questions.question: Considered the greatest baritone saxophonist of all times, he played for many years with Duke Ellington. His signature piece was Sophisticated Lady. Who was he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry Carney

questions.question: The Way You Love Me and Superwoman were just two of this singers hits off of her namesake LP.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Karyn White

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Album and Time
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, death, key. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Axis: Bold As Love is #82 on Rolling Stones list of the top 500 albums. Who recorded it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimi Hendrix

questions.question: The album The Joshua Tree is #27 on Rolling Stones list of the top 500 albums. Who recorded it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: U2

questions.question: Who recorded Songs in the Key of Life, the #57album on Rolling Stones list of the greatest album of all time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stevie Wonder

questions.question: Shakira began her music career as lead singer of a band called La Teir Roe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who recorded Paranoid the #130 album on Rolling Stones list of top 500 albums of all time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black Sabbath

questions.question: Complete these lyrics from the Death Cab for Cutie song What Sarah Said:

options.text: t Im thinking of what Sarah said

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: die

questions.question: Who recorded Purple Rain, the #73 album on Rolling Stones list of the 500 greatest albums of all time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prince

questions.question: Which of these groups recorded a 2006 hit song featuring and produced by Timbaland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: OneRepublic

questions.question: This group gained popularity after recording the song Over My Head (Cable Car).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Fray

questions.question: What artist recorded Physical Graffiti, the album ranked #70 by Rolling Stone magazine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Led Zeppelin

questions.question: Who recorded Imagine, the #77album on Rolling Stones list of the top 500 albums?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Lennon

questions.question: Which of these artists performed the song Nicest Thing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kate Nash

questions.question: This group recorded a song called Viva La Vida that was featured in a iPod commercial?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coldplay

questions.question: Which artist recorded Graceland, the #81album on Rolling Stones list of the greatest albums of all time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Simon

questions.question: Who recorded The Stranger, Rolling Stone magazines #67 album on the top 500 list?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billy Joel

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Jazz and Japan
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, bechet, benny. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: On January 16, 1938 Benny Goodman and his band played at which famous venue?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carneigie Hall

questions.question: What made Wilbur Sweatman, a New York-based jazz musician, famous in jazz history?

options.text: He was the first  recorded jazz violinist.
He played three clarinets at the same time.
He hired  Benny Goodman to come to New York  from Chicago.
He brought young Duke Ellington to New York City.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He played three clarinets at the same time.

questions.question: In Madame Chrysantheme, one of the works the opera Madame Butterfly was based on, the main character has two goals in traveling to Japan. What are they?

options.text: Marrying a Japanese woman and  becoming a Captain
Marrying a Japanese woman and getting a tattoo
Becoming a Captain and getting a real Sanourao sword
Becoming a Captain and getting a medal for bravery

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marrying a Japanese woman and getting a tattoo

questions.question: Who recorded the first jazz LP to sell one million copies?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dave Brubeck

questions.question: The use of Japan as a location for a love story in the opera Madame Butterfly was partially in response to the writings of which European Japanophile?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lafcadio Hearn

questions.question: Who does Miss Chrysantheme, from the novel Madame Chrysantheme by Pierre Loti, really like?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lotis best friend

questions.question: This former Yale dropout and music producer, who spent almost 50 years developing and supporting jazz musicians, was Benny Goodmans brother-in-law.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Hammond

questions.question: King Oliver, Sidney Bechet, Bessie Smith, Jelly Roll Morton, Mamie Smiths Jazz Hounds, and Coleman  Hawkins all made their first recordings in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1923

questions.question: This groups recordings for Columbia in 1917 are considered the first commercial jazz recordings.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Original Dixieland Jazz Band

questions.question: Billy Holiday had her first recording sessions with whose group?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Benny Goodmans

questions.question: Which of these jazz drummers was married to singer and actress Pearl Bailey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louis Bellson

questions.question: In what year was the jazz hit Alexanders Ragtime Band recorded?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1911

questions.question: In the novel Madame Chrysantheme, when Loti leaves Japan, what does Madame Chrysantheme do?

options.text: Cries, begs, and then goes to her house to count her money.
Accepts his leaving and moves back to her father’s house.
Cries, begs, and then kills herself.
Begs, yells, and complains to Lotis Commander.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cries, begs, and then goes to her house to count her money.

questions.question: In the 1930s this music company began buying up smaller labels such as Okeh and became the major recording company for  jazz and blues records.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Columbia

questions.question: Who wrote the first major Western novel set in Japan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pierre Loti
